intro: Casearia fissistipula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved casearia, is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in catkin-like inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
